poem:
**Dishes of Decadence**

The plates, heaped with 
glistening desire,
knives carve futures
on arteries' edge. 

Night after night, 
our critic, 
beneath tablecloths of linen
writes his epitaph
between courses,
salted truths
and sugared lies 
season his heart 
with each bite.
